name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YasmeenSerhan: The fight to save Uighur culture is well underway in the diaspora—and it's being led by chefs, poets, singers, filmmakers, language teachers, and musicians. 

My latest: https://t.co/sreEYZd4uz

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @prashantrao: The 'Trump of the Tropics' got the coronavirus, too, and emerged from it even stronger than before.

Read @realcpaz in @TheAtlantic for more on what Jair Bolsonaro's COVID-19 experience tells us about Donald Trump's https://t.co/GnQOMomVrb

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: How do you protect a culture that is being wiped out? https://t.co/ucdtgj43Rg

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: “McConnell could try other options, such as replacing Lee and Tillis on the Judiciary Committee, or bypassing the panel entirely, but each of those would require majority votes on the Senate floor that he might struggle to win.” https://t.co/6GWj8nb1D6

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @russellberman: Democrats can't stop Amy Coney Barrett's nomination to the Supreme Court. But will the virus? https://t.co/hO1NAwqZ9E

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @NickBaumann: NEW: For the moment, COVID-19 diagnoses have jeopardized three votes that Republicans can't afford to lose in their fight to get Amy Coney Barrett onto the Supreme Court, @russellberman reports: https://t.co/memA5eE9HZ

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JohnGHendy: Big: According to Congressional procedure, if Lee and Tillis aren't physically present to achieve a quorum, Democrats could boycott the Amy Coney Barrett hearing and block the vote. 

More: https://t.co/3wiusK01o0 via @russellberman

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @mckaycoppins: Why do we have the impulse to tell whoever’s closest when major news breaks? @julieebeck reports: https://t.co/lsZq2tITX2

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: A strange and fascinating piece by @sarahzhang about remdesivir, the experimental antiviral that the president is taking. https://t.co/AExwuuuZtv

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @amywilentz: Here’s my piece on @realDonaldTrump and his recent diagnosis:

https://t.co/Ysm741NeoG

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @SwatiGauri: "The geopolitical order hangs in the balance, waiting for incremental updates on Trump’s pulmonary function." @jameshamblin helps us understand with the little information we have:  https://t.co/SP6xJtHt7S

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @SwatiGauri: "During the pandemic, I have not lived like the president. Instead of wearing a mask over my eyes, I’ve confronted the reality of the virus, and worn it where it needs to be worn...

I don’t shake hands with anyone. Do you?" https://t.co/T3IEQT39Rr

name: TheAtlantic
text: In “Praying on a 707,” published in The Atlantic in 1972, Anne Sexton describes trying to talk to God as she ascends into the clouds on an airplane: https://t.co/nT1psflMQ9

name: TheAtlantic
text: How do you protect a culture from being wiped out? For Uighurs living outside of China, this is more than just a hypothetical, writes @YasmeenSerhan. It's the key to ensuring that their heritage will be passed on to future generations. https://t.co/iWUF3yXbpB

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @DKThomp: Given Trump's age, gender, and weight, an ICU visit would not be surprising. But given the variable nature of the disease, neither would a Monday discharge. @jameshamblin 

https://t.co/FSHR3zhFcq https://t.co/M8La1zV9Jj

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @SwatiGauri: "Republicans, however, now face a more complicated path to a Supreme Court confirmation, one imperiled by their own laxity toward the pandemic." From @russellberman:  https://t.co/F8cRjrrwkH

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: A very thoughtful piece by @YasmeenSerhan about a terrible situation:
https://t.co/rLr5fWegdj

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: “Every Uighur now is under very big psychological pressure ... We cannot sleep at night.” https://t.co/ucdtgj43Rg

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: The Uighur diaspora is faced with the task of "preserving and promoting their identity in countries where few people might know who the Uighurs are, let alone what the world stands to lose should their language, food, art, and traditions be eradicated." https://t.co/ucdtgj43Rg

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdamHSays: I know there’s _a lot_ of news right now, but if you’d like a change of pace, this week, we released #TheFirsts—a series of profiles of the first Black students to desegregate America’s schools. https://t.co/cn6ianQkVw
